question_stem.en: A 20-year-old man is evaluated in the clinic for right arm weakness and numbness. He pitches for his college baseball team and threw more than usual last week due to a postseason tournament. Since then, the patient has had difficulty using his right arm, particularly when lifting objects. He has no history of head, neck, or upper extremity trauma. On physical examination, there is diminished strength on right elbow flexion and an absent biceps reflex. This patient is most likely to have sensory loss over which of the following areas?
question_stem.zh: 一名20岁的男性在诊所接受评估，原因是右臂无力和麻木。他为大学棒球队投球，由于季后赛，上周投得比平时多。从那以后，患者难以使用右臂，尤其是在举起物体时。他没有头部、颈部或上肢外伤史。体格检查显示右肘屈曲力量减弱，肱二头肌反射消失。该患者最有可能在以下哪个区域出现感觉丧失？

question.en: This patient is most likely to have sensory loss over which of the following areas?
question.zh: 该患者最有可能在以下哪个区域出现感觉丧失？

explanation.en:
This patient likely has a MUSCULOCUTANEOUS NERVE injury, which most commonly occurs in the setting of trauma (shoulder dislocation) and can also occur with strenuous upper extremity activity (eg, baseball pitching). The musculocutaneous nerve is derived from the C5-C7 spinal nerve roots and arises from the lateral cord of the brachial plexus. It innervates the coracobrachialis (flexes and adducts the arm) and major elbow flexors (eg, biceps brachii, brachialis). After innervating these muscles, the remaining fibers become the lateral cutaneous nerve of the forearm and provide SENSORY INNERVATION to the skin of the lateral forearm. In addition to having weakness of elbow flexion and numbness of the lateral forearm, patients with musculocutaneous nerve injury have an absent or weak biceps reflex. {{exhibit_1}} {{exhibit_2}}

(Choice B) The medial forearm receives sensory innervation from a branch of the medial cord of the brachial plexus, the musculocutaneous nerve of the forearm (also called the medial antebrachial cutaneous nerve).

(Choices C and D) The posterior arm and forearm receive sensory innervation from branches of the radial nerve.

(Choice E) The thenar eminence receives sensory innervation from the palmar cutaneous branch of the median nerve, which arises proximal to the carpal tunnel.

Educational objective:
The musculocutaneous nerve innervates the coracobrachialis (flexes and adducts the arm) and the major elbow flexors (eg, biceps brachii, brachialis) and then continues distally to provide sensory innervation to the lateral forearm. It is derived from the upper trunk of the brachial plexus (C5-C7) and can be injured by trauma or strenuous upper extremity exercise.

References
• Peripheral nerve entrapment and injury in the upper extremity.
explanation.zh:
该患者可能患有肌肉皮神经损伤，这种损伤最常发生在创伤（肩关节脱位）的情况下，也可能发生在剧烈上肢活动（例如，棒球投球）中。肌肉皮神经源自C5-C7脊神经根，并起自臂丛神经的外侧束。它支配喙肱肌（屈曲和内收手臂）和主要的肘屈肌（例如，肱二头肌、肱肌）。在支配这些肌肉后，剩余的纤维成为前臂外侧皮神经，并为外侧前臂的皮肤提供感觉支配。除了肘屈曲无力和外侧前臂麻木外，肌肉皮神经损伤的患者还存在肱二头肌反射消失或减弱的情况。{{exhibit_1}} {{exhibit_2}}

(选项 B) 内侧前臂接受来自臂丛神经内侧束分支的感觉神经支配，即前臂的肌肉皮神经（也称为内侧前臂皮神经）。

(选项 C 和 D) 后臂和前臂接受来自桡神经分支的感觉神经支配。

(选项 E) 鱼际隆起接受来自正中神经的掌皮支的感觉神经支配，该神经起自腕管近端。

教育目标：
肌肉皮神经支配喙肱肌（屈曲和内收手臂）和主要的肘屈肌（例如，肱二头肌、肱肌），然后继续向远端提供对外侧前臂的感觉神经支配。它源自臂丛神经的上干（C5-C7），可能因外伤或剧烈的上肢运动而受损。

参考文献
• 上肢周围神经卡压和损伤。

summary.en:
This question tests the understanding of the anatomy and function of the musculocutaneous nerve, including its motor and sensory distributions, and common causes of injury. It requires correlating clinical findings such as weakness in elbow flexion, absent biceps reflex, and sensory loss in a specific distribution with a particular nerve injury.

To solve this question, one must first identify the affected nerve based on the motor deficits (elbow flexion weakness) and reflex changes (absent biceps reflex). Then, recall the sensory distribution of that nerve to determine the area of sensory loss. Considering the mechanism of injury (strenuous pitching) can also help narrow down the possibilities.
summary.zh:
此题考察对肌肉皮神经的解剖结构和功能的理解，包括其运动和感觉分布，以及常见的损伤原因。它要求将临床表现，例如肘屈曲无力、肱二头肌反射消失以及特定分布的感觉丧失，与特定的神经损伤相关联。

要解决这个问题，首先必须根据运动功能障碍（肘屈曲无力）和反射改变（肱二头肌反射消失）确定受影响的神经。然后，回忆该神经的感觉分布以确定感觉丧失的区域。考虑损伤机制（剧烈投球）也有助于缩小可能性。
